trans-unit.source: Provides a page adapter for the XHTML adapter set.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter> class inherits the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlControlAdapter> class and implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IPageAdapter> class.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Gets a list of any additional HTTP headers by which caching is varied.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter> class inherits the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.CacheVaryByHeaders%2A> property from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IPageAdapter> interface and always returns `null`.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> object of additional HTTP headers.
Gets or sets the current cookieless <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page.Session"></xref> property data, if any.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.CookielessDataDictionary%2A> property is populated when a valid <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface is configured as an attribute of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControlsSection> element.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> containing key/value pairs for the current cookieless <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext.Session"></xref> data, if any; otherwise, `null`.
Creates and returns a text writer that is appropriate for the target device.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> object or an object inherited from the <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.Web.UI.XhtmlTextWriter"></xref> object based on the provided <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> object.
Returns the postback data collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Because some devices handle postback differently from others, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.DeterminePostBackMode%2A> method allows the adapter to modify the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest"></xref> object that contains request information.
The source identifier for the event.
An argument identifier for the event.
The collection of postback data from the request object.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> object containing all query string or form parameters and values.
Indicates whether the device adapter set applies to the specified request.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> object for the current request.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.PreferredRenderingType"></xref> for the browser is one of these members of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.Doctype"></xref> object: <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.Doctype.XhtmlBasic"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.Doctype.XhtmlMobileProfile"></xref>, or <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.Doctype.Wml20"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the key for submitting the event argument.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

If an inheriting adapter overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.EventArgumentKey%2A> property, it must also override the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.DeterminePostBackMode%2A> method to process the postback.
A string representing the key.
Gets the key for submitting the event source.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

If an inheriting adapter overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.EventSourceKey%2A> property, it must also override the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.DeterminePostBackMode%2A> method to process the postback.
A string representing the key.
Called if an unhandled error occurs on the page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An adapter can choose to handle the error and display an error message.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter> class does nothing and returns `false`.
An <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> object.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.
`false`.
Indicates whether the adapter handles the postback event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.HandlePagePostBackEvent%2A> method is called during postback.
An adapter can choose to handle the event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter> class does not handle the postback event and always returns `false`.
The source identifier for the event.
The name of the event.
`false`.
Configures the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref> object for the target device.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.InitWriterState%2A> method is called before rendering the page.
This method sets the following properties on `writer` for the target device:
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref> object.
Sets conditional pagination for the page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.OnPreRender%2A> method checks the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.ActiveForm%2A> property for the page.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form.Action%2A> property is not empty, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Panel.Paginate%2A> property for the active form is set to `false`.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.OnPreRender%2A> method calls the base <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.OnPreRender%2A> method before exiting.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.Form%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Panel?displayProperty=fullName> class, which provides the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Panel.Paginate%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.OnPreRender(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method.
Gets a page weight that is appropriate for the target device.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An integer that represents the optimal number of bytes for a page on the target device.
Gets or sets the page to which the adapter is attached.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage"></xref> object.

Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.CookielessDataDictionary"></xref> property are persisted in the query string.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
`true` if the `CookielessDataDictionaryType` in the `MobileControls` configuration section of the Web.config file is set to a valid dictionary type; otherwise, `false`.
Sends the page content to a provided <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref>, which renders the content to the client.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref> object that writes the content to the client browser.
Creates a link on the current page to enable postback on devices that do not support postback events.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Some devices are able to execute a postback event on a link or button only.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.RenderUrlPostBackEvent%2A> method writes a link with a URL that contains all of the information that is required to process the form and to update and display the page.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref> object that writes the link.
The target URL for postback.
The name of the event for which the link is substituting.
